intro_text: Here on the plains, the reaches of c_n's territory is vast, particularly in the direction p_l and {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} patrol are heading, where there is endless grass but no permanent water sources. Still, with the grass at it's newleaf minimum, they can see where they're going.
decline_text: The patrol is interrupted by a hunting patrol that needs help carrying prey back to camp - border marking will wait til later.

success_outcomes.text: There's a good crop of new grass along this border. It's worth noting, and p_l will report the potential hunting spot when they return to camp.

s_c isn't just talented at running fast - {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/have/has} some very good advice and {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/share/shares} {PRONOUN/s_c/poss} tips for endurance. The other cats purr gratitude at the end of the day. Everyone's exhausted, but they made it the entire length of that far off border thanks to s_c.
p_l really pushes them, to be able to patrol all the far border in a single patrol. They make it, and are congratulated on the achivement when they come back into camp after dark, panting.

fail_outcomes.text: They trek, and they wander, and they amble, and they pad. But as the sun creeps over the sky, before they reach the far border itself, p_l spots r_c limping. it's nothing, {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/say/says}, just sleeping on the leg wrong. But far from camp isn't the right place to be limping, and p_l calls the patrol off.

Before they reach the far border itself, p_l spots s_c limping. it's nothing, {PRONOUN/s_c/subject} {VERB/s_c/say/says}, and refuses to stop. But in these far reaches, in territory not commonly checked, other predators intrude. When a young, inexperienced cougar charges the patrol, s_c should have been able to run fast enoguh to escape. Should.

history_text.reg_death: This cat was killed after continuing to patrol the far border while injured by a young, inexperienced cougar.
history_text.lead_death: by a cougar while patrolling the far border
